alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Lee (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 11:07PM CDT until May 08 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT MONDAY FOR NORTHERN LA SALLE AND SOUTHEASTERN LEE COUNTIES... At 1107 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall had moved out of the area. Although additional showers are developing just to the west, they currently are not heavy enough to worsen existing flooding. Standing water from earlier rainfall will likely remain for the next few hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Continued flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations may continue to experience flooding include... Sublette, Mendota, Sheridan, Wedron, and Norway. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
